qas.question: What does it show when a wrestler has many titles?

answers.text: ability to maintain audience interest and/or a wrestler's ability to perform in the ring

qas.question: What can be important in a wrestler's career?

answers.text: multiple world heavyweight championship reigns spanning over three decades

context: A wrestler's <a1_0>championship accomplishments<a1_0/> can be central to their career, becoming a measure of their <a2_0>performance ability and drawing power<a2_0/>. In general, a wrestler with multiple title reigns or an extended title reign is indicative of a wrestler's <a0_0>ability to maintain audience interest and/or a wrestler's ability to perform in the ring<a0_0/>. As such, the most accomplished or decorated wrestlers tend to be revered as legends despite the predetermined nature of title reigns. American wrestler Ric Flair has had <a3_0>multiple world heavyweight championship reigns spanning over three decades<a3_0/>. Japanese wrestler <a4_0>Último Dragón<a4_0/> once held and defended a record 10 titles simultaneously.
